sentences: Tema küsib, kuhu me läheme kahte nädalat pärast.
Poisid jooksid üksteise järel kahte kilomeetrit.
context: The word 'kahte' is the partitive case form of the Estonian number 'kaks', meaning 'two'. In this form, it's used with countable nouns that are in the singular or when indicating direction towards something. It can also mean 'twice' as an adverb.
